intro: Perrierangraecum ankeranense, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
